title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Not issued any advisory to stop finance to renewables: MNRE
items.summary:
- The **MNRE** clarified it has not issued any advisory to *financial institutions* to stop lending to renewable energy projects or to renewable energy equipment manufacturing facilities.
- It said it has circulated the status of domestic *solar PV manufacturing* to lenders to enable a calibrated financing approach, not to halt funding.
- The ministry will continue engaging with stakeholders to keep India's solar journey *inclusive*, *competitive*, and *future-ready*, supported by the PLI scheme and ALMM.

items.title: EAM talks deeper cooperation at India-Japan Forum
items.summary: - **EAM S Jaishankar** participated in the India-Japan Forum opening session in New Delhi, discussing the evolving world order and deeper *India-Japan cooperation*.\n- The forum aims to bolster cooperation, build mutual trust, and develop a joint agenda for future cooperation, with 70–80 high-level participants under Chatham House rules.\n- Earlier remarks in 2024 highlighted strengthening ties in *semiconductor collaboration*, defence and resilient supply chains, underscoring the growing strategic partnership.

items.title: Coking coal imports rise in Oct on winter restocking
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Coking coal imports rose 12% to *5.04 MT*, aided by *winter restocking* by steel mills, while **overall coal imports** fell 3.9% to 20.97 MT.
- The decline in imports reflects a domestic surplus; steel manufacturers usually boost purchases before colder months to secure supplies.
- Initiatives like the **Coking Coal Mission** and the *WDO route* aim to raise domestic coking coal use and curb imports, with Q4 imports likely subdued as domestic production rises.

items.title: Manomay expands capacity, adopts cleaner production
items.summary:
- Rajasthan-based Manomay Tex India Ltd is expanding capacity with 864 spindles and pursuing *cleaner production* for sustainable growth.
- It is strengthening its domestic and international footprint, exporting to 16+ countries including Colombia, Mexico, Egypt, Chile, and Venezuela.
- In H1 FY26, revenue reached ₹330 crore and PAT ₹10 crore, aided by measures like zero liquid discharge, water recycling, and renewable energy.

items.title: The solar surge and the supply chain gap: India’s energy triumph and industrial paradox
SFO Tech mulling ₹2,270 crore electronic components plant in Tamil Nadu
Goyal holds key meetings on semiconductors, carbon capture
items.summary:
- *Goyal* met Sanjiv Lamba, CEO of **Linde plc**, to explore opportunities in **semiconductors**, *advanced manufacturing*, decarbonisation and **carbon capture**, aligning with **Aatmanirbhar Bharat** and a developed India by 2047.
- He also spoke with David Rosa, CEO of **Intuitive Surgical**, on **MedTech** ecosystem growth and expanding India's Global Capacity Centre (GCC).
- The talks emphasize building a resilient industrial ecosystem to boost healthcare, manufacturing and energy transition toward a self-reliant, developed India by 2047.

items.title: Mobile phone imports drop to 0.02% of demand in 2024-25
items.author: Press Trust of India
items.summary: - Mobile phone imports have fallen to *0.02%* of domestic demand in 2024-25, down from *75%* in *2014-15*.\n- Mobile phone exports surged to ₹2 lakh crore in 2024-25, up *127x* from ₹0.01 lakh crore in *2014-15*.\n- The government’s measures, including *PLI schemes* and *Atma Nirbhar Bharat*, aim to boost domestic electronics manufacturing.

items.title: Cabinet push to healthcare manufacturing, life science hub
items.summary: - The Bhubaneswar cabinet approved the Odisha Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Policy-2025 to position Odisha as a hub for *healthcare manufacturing* and *life science sectors*.\n- It envisages the Odisha Pharma Park and Odisha Medtech Park to provide industrial infrastructure, with the **Odisha Pharmaceutical Development Cell** as the lead agency.\n- The policy maps a strategic route and cluster formation to realize a prosperous Odisha by 2036 and a developed India by 2047.

items.title: Apple rocked by executive departures, with chip chief at risk of leaving next
Tembo Global ups stake to 75% in defence arm with ₹126.71 crore infusion
Biocon to merge Biocon Biologics into parent in $5.5-billion integration move
EPC sector emerges as major job engine, poised for 25 million roles by 2030: Report
India, Russia discuss cooperation on small modular reactors and floating nuclear plants
Dynamatic to build Falcon 6X rear fuselage
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Dassault Aviation* and *Dynamatic Technologies* signed a deal to manufacture the complete rear fuselage for the Falcon 6X. 
- The contract expands a 2024 collaboration, adding full rear fuselage assembly after earlier success with the rear fuel tank. 
- Executives highlight Make in India, quality, and precision engineering.

items.title: Moore Threads soars after $1.1B IPO
items.summary: - *Moore Threads* surged on its Shanghai debut, opening at 650 yuan, well above the IPO price of 114.28 yuan.\n- Beijing's drive to boost domestic chipmaking and U.S. export curbs on advanced chips highlight *Moore Threads* as a potential local AI GPU supplier, with Sinolink Securities initiating coverage with a **Buy** rating and a 182.25 yuan target.\n- The company raised nearly 8 billion yuan in the IPO, underscoring its role in reducing reliance on foreign chips and its long-term significance for China's chip ambitions.

items.title: Arm plans chip design school in S Korea
items.summary:
- Arm Holdings and South Korea's industry ministry signed an MoU to bolster the semiconductor and *AI* sectors and to set up a chip-design school. 
- The program aims to train about *1,400* high-level chip design specialists to strengthen Korea's system-semiconductor and fabless segments. 
- The move aligns with Korea's ambition to be a top *AI power*, leveraging Arm's expertise to expand its chip ecosystem.

items.title: Dutch minister defends Nexperia takeover amid chip strains
items.summary:
- The Dutch Economic Affairs Minister Vincent Karremans defended seizing *Nexperia*, saying the step reduced Europe’s dependence on non‑European *legacy chips*.
- He argued there was little time and that coordination carried risks, while lawmakers framed the move as a **lone-wolf** action.
- Even as the two governments eased controls, *Nexperia* faces an internal split, with its Chinese packaging arm declaring independence and European wafers shipments halted.

items.title: Foxconn exit crumbles China's industrial empire under CCP
items.summary:
- *Foxconn* relocated the Henyang facility, leaving 30,000 workers without work and signaling a wider retreat of manufacturing in central China. 
- Henan's mobile-phone exports fell 60% in early 2024 and overall trade shrank nearly 25%, as firms shift to *Vietnam* and *India*. 
- Analysts cite rising costs, policy volatility and *CCP governance* as root causes, accelerating the exodus and hurting workers.

items.title: Taiwan's Allegiance invest ₹1,000 crore in Karnataka ITIP
items.summary:
- Karnataka signed an MoU with Allegiance Group to establish the Indo-Taiwan Industrial Technology Innovation Park (**ITIP**) with around ₹1,000 crore investment and about 800 direct jobs over five years. 
- The **ITIP** will be a hub for Taiwanese electronics and **semiconductors**, boosting R&D, supply chains, and Karnataka's **ESDM** ecosystem. 
- Leaders say the partnership advances Karnataka's vision to become a global hub for electronics and semiconductor innovation and attract global investors.

items.title: Will deploy smart factory solutions at SCL fab: Applied Materials India head
items.author: Suraksha P
items.summary:
- Applied Materials India has been selected as the **L1 bidder** for bid package-3 in SCL Mohali’s fab automation upgrade.
- The project focuses on implementing the **Manufacturing Execution System (MES)** and advanced semiconductor automation in SCL’s 200 mm fab to boost productivity and efficiency.
- Avi Avula, president of Applied Materials India, says the initiative reinforces *Make in India* and *Invent in India*, strengthening India's position in the global semiconductor value chain with **SmartFactory** solutions.

items.title: India’s electronics manufacturing grows six-fold in 11 years to ₹11.32 lakh crore in FY25: Jitin Prasada
IFC backs GFL unit for India's first battery-materials plant
items.summary: - *IFC* commits about $50 million to GFCL EV Products Ltd, a *GFL* subsidiary, to develop India’s first fully integrated battery-materials plant near Jolva, Gujarat.\n- The facility will produce LiPF6 electrolyte formulations, lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cathode materials, and PVDF/PTFE binders for *EVs* and energy-storage systems, strengthening India's domestic supply chain.\n- The investment aims to reduce import reliance, boost domestic manufacturing, and accelerate India's role in the global clean-energy ecosystem, with Barclays as financial adviser.

items.title: Modi-Putin: Manufacturing, pharma & tech ties
items.summary:
- **Pharmaceuticals** cooperation: joint vaccine development, health care, cancer therapies, radiopharmaceuticals and API supply chains, with potential ties in fertilisers, textiles and electronics to accelerate the $100B trade goal. 
- Advanced tech collaboration: progress in **digitalisation**, autonomous robotics and high‑tech medical equipment, underpinned by *co‑innovation* and *co‑creation*. 
- Workforce and training: Modi cited India's growing skilled workforce and urged training youth in Russian language and soft skills to create a **Russia-ready workforce** and strengthen manufacturing ties.

items.title: Fineotex acquires CrudeChem Technologies Group
items.summary:
- Fineotex Chemical acquires CrudeChem Technologies Group to expand into *North America*.
- The acquisition gives access to a *$11.5 billion North American market* across midstream, refining and water treatment.
- Management plans to build a *$200 million oil field chemical business* and a global platform focused on innovation and **environmental responsibility**.

items.title: Bengal to launch 660 MW Sagardighi unit on Dec 10
items.author: Dwaipayan Ghosh
items.summary:
- The *660 MW Sagardighi* supercritical unit, built by *WBPDCL*, will start operations from **Dec 10**.
- This would be **Bengal's largest** and **NE India's first** supercritical power plant, built at over ₹4,567 crore and expected to supply power to about *16.7 lakh families*.
- The project is expected to create around **26,000 jobs** and significantly boost Bengal's generation capacity from about **6,000 MW**.

items.title: Modi, Putin expand India–Russia cooperation with 2030 agenda covering energy, transport links, critical minerals
SKF India (Industrial) lists on bourses after demerger; plans ₹800–950 crore capex through 2030
Lupin gets USFDA nod for multiple sclerosis drug
BEML wins ₹157 crore order to manufacture switch rail grinding machines
BEML, Sagarmala Finance Corp ink pact to boost country's maritime manufacturing sector
Cyient IP for ₹4,500-cr SCL upgrade
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Cyient Semiconductors has been technically qualified to supply and validate IP for the ₹4,500-crore SCL modernisation in Mohali under **ISM**.*
- *The programme expands domestic chip-making capacity, reduces import reliance, and opens **fabrication facilities** to startups, academia, and strategic sectors.*
- *Cyient will supply and qualify three foundational technologies—**RF-CMOS**, **BCD (HV LDMOS)**, and **CIS**—for SCL’s upgraded 8-inch fab.*

items.title: PTC arm inks Honeywell titanium castings pact
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Under the agreement, Aerolloy Technologies will produce *titanium* and *superalloy* precision investment castings through a vertically integrated process at its Uttar Pradesh facility for Honeywell Aerospace.
- The deal covers *aero-engine components*, enhances *traceability*, and provides long-term reliability and multi-year revenue visibility for global OEMs.
- PTC Industries chairman Sachin Agarwal says the collaboration reinforces India's position in the global aerospace supply chain and showcases ATL's capabilities.

items.title: Waaree Solar Americas wins 288 MW module supply order from US-based firm
India's renewable energy shift: States, C&I sector, and rooftop solar drive future growth
Australia eyes deeper India ties through critical minerals cooperation
India, Russia eye trade boost with more diversified basket
Karnataka eyes $150B electronics investment
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - Industries Minister *M B Patil* directed officials to draft a policy to boost mobile and electronics manufacturing, aiming for about *$150 billion* in investments. - Patil met delegations led by *Pankaj Mohindroo* of *ICEA* to discuss Karnataka’s approach and parallel schemes with the Centre. - Mohindroo noted the Union scheme prioritises displays/camera modules and offers incentives while Karnataka studies feasibility for alignment with other states.

items.title: Iveco Defence Orders Rise on EU SAFE Plan
items.summary:
- *Iveco Defence Vehicles* sees a near-term order uptick driven by the EU's *SAFE* plan, with production needing to accelerate.
- IDV is expanding capacity in Bolzano and Piacenza and setting up a propulsion engines division in Turin, tied to a deal with **Leonardo** valued at **€1.7 billion** for completion in **Q1 2026**.
- The EU *SAFE* scheme aims to boost bloc defence capabilities, prompting suppliers to scale up and better serve European allies.

items.title: Suzlon unveils plan for 3 new AI-enabled smart blade units
Andhra Pradesh to get India's 1st 6 GW ingot-wafer plant
items.author: Nidhi Sharma, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- India will get its first integrated 6 GW ingot-wafer solar plant in *Anakapalli*, Andhra Pradesh by *ReNew Photovoltaics*.
- The *₹3,990 crore* project is backed by the central *PLI* scheme and aims to cut reliance on Chinese imports while boosting **300 GW** by 2030.
- The plant will span ~130–140 acres, with completion expected by March 2026 and commercial production by January 2028.

items.title: India seeks stronger Russia backing for indigenous defence tech
RBI lifts FY26 GDP growth forecast to 7.3% on strong domestic demand
RBI cuts FY26 inflation forecast to 2% as food prices ease
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- RBI trims FY26 CPI inflation forecast to 2%, down from 2.6%, led by a sharper fall in food prices.
- Governor Sanjay Malhotra says the decline is now more generalised, aided by better food supply, reservoir levels and favourable weather, with core inflation easing.
- RBI projects 2.6% in Q3 and 2.9% in Q4 this year, with 3.9–4% in Q1–Q2 next year, while risks are evenly balanced.

items.title: RBI MPC cuts repo rate to 5.25%, keeps neutral stance
items.summary:
- The MPC cut the *repo rate by 25 bps to 5.25%* as inflation cools and there is room to *support growth*, while keeping a *neutral stance*.
- Governor *Sanjay Malhotra* noted disinflation and that headline/core inflation may hover around 4% in H1 next year within the 2–6% band.
- To ensure liquidity, RBI announced open market purchases of government securities worth ₹1 lakh crore and a three-year $5B swap, signaling continued policy support.

items.title: Raymond Group appoints Rakesh Tiwary as Group CFO
items.summary: - Rakesh Tiwary is appointed **Group CFO** of the *Raymond Group*, effective **Dec 3, 2025**.\n- He brings over 25 years of *financial leadership* across cement, airports, electricity, solar, steel, oil and infrastructure.\n- The move aligns with Raymond's three-entity restructuring to deepen financial discipline and unlock *shareholder value*.

items.title: Corning exec Andrew Beck says everyone’s eyes are on India market
Tata, Cyient, Applied Materials units emerge as L1 bidders for SCL fab upgrade
From 2 hours to 10 minutes: Inside Apollo Tyres’ AI revolution
Intel says it will keep networking and communications unit
items.summary:
- Intel will keep its NEX networking and communications unit in-house after a strategic review, saying tighter integration between silicon, software and systems will boost offerings in *AI*, *data center*, and *edge*.
- The decision follows Intel weighing asset sales; the company has improved its cash position after an **$8.9B** U.S. government investment for a 10% stake and **$2B** from SoftBank plus **$5B** from Nvidia.
- Earlier this year Reuters reported Intel explored spinning out NEX as part of CEO *Lip-Bu Tan*'s plan to shave off non-core businesses.
